Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • Menu

  • public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
    The Menu class This class represents the Window that has all the graphics and mechanics for the main menu of the Waterworks program. It extends the abstract Window class to use its basic mechanics methods for displaying, hiding and clearing the screen. The class allows the user to press ImageView buttons to indicate which Window they wish to enter. This indication of their choice is returned to the StageManager through the getChoice method, which also manages and drives all the class methods.

    Course Information:

    ICS4U0 with Krasteva, V.

    Total Time Spent: 3 hours

    Version:
    6 06.09.2019

 June 3:

 June 6:

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void display()
      This method displays all the graphics, and implements all the buttons of the Menu window.
      int getChoice()
      This method drives the class by running the appropriate methods at the right times, and returning the chosen option to StageManager.
      void showAndWait()
      Hide the Stage in case it isn't already hidden and then show it, and wait until it is hidden once again before continuing with the current Thread.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        This method displays all the graphics, and implements all the buttons of the Menu window.

      • getChoice

        public int getChoice()
        This method drives the class by running the appropriate methods at the right times, and returning the chosen option to StageManager.
        Returns:
        The menu option chosen by the user.

      • showAndWait

        public void showAndWait()
        Hide the Stage in case it isn't already hidden and then show it, and wait until it is hidden once again before continuing with the current Thread.
